title: @Meddler: Is Koggy getting any sort of update with the Marksmen pass?
body:
I ask because, speaking from the ADC side of things, Koggy may as well not exist in Solo.  The only ADC with a lower pick rate than Kog is Quinn (who's getting a remake).  And while Koggy *does* get picked in LCS level play, two thirds of the time he's used as a solo-mid AP.

As it stands Vayne does the Tank-Buster thing more reliably than Kog while Jinx does the long-range auto-attacker thing more reliably.  Koggy really needs something *other* than his quintessential weaknesses as a stand-out feature from champions vying for a similar niche.

Here's a question regarding Kog'Maw:

Have you ever considered increasing his base attack range, but lowering the bonus range that Bio-Arcane Barrage gives? It'd be something like this:

- Increase Kog'Maw's attack range to 550 from 500.
- Lower the bonus range of Bio-Arcane Barrage to 80/100/120/140/160.
- Total attack range while Bio-Arcane Barrage is active is still 630/650/670/690/710.

What would this do? It'd make Kog'Maw far safer when his W is down. Right now his 500 attack range and complete lack of mobility means he won't even DARE to try to attack someone while his W is on cooldown. Other 500 range ADCs compensate for that lack of safety wiith mobility, but this is Koggie we're talking about. No mobility is a requirement on him.

Have you considered this kind of change? If so, is there a reason it hasn't been tried?
That would be a pretty massive buff.

That's all by design. Active gives him hilarious range as well as %HP damage so he gets garbage range when it's down. If you were to increase his base range you'd have to reduce his total range with W active or reduce the %HP damage to even things out.

For what it's worth, I've played pretty much every form of Kog you can imagine (and probably a few you can't).  So I know full well the joys of AP Koggy.

How would you feel about Riot unifying the two builds like they did with AP/AD Yi when they did his gameplay update?  Say, Ult going to physical damage and counting as a single target spell when he hits one unit ala Karthus' Q so he could get the full benefit of Mura?  That would allow AP Kog's ult-spam playstyle to be preserved.

Or do you think it would be more fun to make him into a full-on AP Marksmen more akin to Kayle?

Of those two, AP marksmen is the preferrable option, so long as he keeps his poke, as that is his calling card. Making him AD based would make items like Rylai's, Liandry's, Void Staff, and Luden's (which are all common AP Kog items) much less useful. Though making his ult single target when it hits a single person would make Mura better, It doesn't help in teamfights as much as you'd like, as you generally want to tag a few enemies at once whenever possible.

If I might offer a suggestion, his q and passive are both mediocre on both Kogs most of the time. If you want to preserve his AP playstyle while buffing his AD, then those abilities could both be more geared toward when people are close to you. Rage passive,  lifesteal and spellvamp, stacking mixed pen (kayle style), attack speed, or cdr (so you get his w up more often) seems like something that might help him imo. Particularly a free (weaker) rage passive would help ad kog, as it would allow him to kite more effectively, giving him a slightly less team reliant playstyle without removing the periods of counterplay when his w is down. It also isn't on any other champs I can think of at the moment.

This is part of the issue with Koggy.

He's a pretty solid pick at the LCS level where teams can be built around him (though again, he ends up running AP twice as often as not).  But down in Solo-land that level of organization just isn't going to happen.  In Solo Koggy typically hovers around a 'balanced' win-rate about on par with MF whilst having his non-existent pick rate.

Basically, he's got the same problem Azir does.  Amazing competitive presence, meh for mere mortals.  How do you balance something like that?  How do you make him attractive for Solo without making him an unstoppable monster in LCS?

The only thing I can think of is somehow divorcing his damage from his range.  A medium range, super-high damage mode and a super-long range medium damage mode.  That would let him be a bit more self-reliant in Solo while at the same time reducing the power of his ideal-use case up in LCS play.
so turn him into Jinx?

> [{quoted}](name=BluePolarizer,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=aI1IAEbe,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2015-09-26T17:50:17.852+0000)
>
> so turn him into Jinx?

No.

For it to work as stated on Koggy it would need to effectively toggle his whole *kit*.  Remember, AP Kog gets as much, if not more, play as AP in high level games.  Koggy's W would have to work like a transformation-type toggle.

A Koggle-Toggle, if you will.

Shared cooldowns, but drastically different ranges.  Toggle off, Kog's %HP damage applies to his autos and skills, but range goes way down.  THey would possibly need to get swapped over to targeted skills, too.  Toggle on, range jumps up to what he's got on live, but with no %HP damage.  Base damage on his skills would probably need to go down a bit, though.

That would make him less potentially oppressive in high-level games, but upping his damage at medium range so he can peel for himself with raw face-melting damage as a fall-back play pattern would allow him to function more reliably in Solo play.

Probably won't happen, though.

It sounds like he's just getting some number tweaks, which has got me a bit worried.  Giving Koggy straight buffs so that he's an attractive pick in Solo would likely break him for LCS play.
but that's exactly what Jinx has: self peel on E, long range ult, and a toggle to go from high damage medium range to medium (single target) damage high range.

Part of the problem is that Jinx, from her inception, was already Kog 2.0.  Super long range auto-attacker with a poke that reveals the target, better self-peel, passive attack speed, and situational mobility (Koggy gets a speed buff when he dies, Jinx gets it when she kills stuff.  Which is more useful?).  Even her Ult allows her to Tankbust to a degree due to its execute, though obviously not quite as well as Kog.

It's something that has bugged me ever since Jinx was released.  Obviously Riot isn't going to remake Jinx from the ground up.  She's way too popular for that.  Kog is neglected with the likes of Quinn and Urgot, so he seems like the obvious choice.  But how do you do it?  He's great in super-organized LCS play, but he's just a shitty Jinx with a little more damage or a shitty Vayne with more range over in Solo.  AP Kog's Ult is overbearing in LCS play.  AD Kog's W is overbearing in LCS play.  But in Solo?

He needs to be altered so he's less dominating in LCS while also giving him a niche in Solo that isn't trampled all over by Vayne and Jinx.

So how do you do that?  I have a hard time imagining numbers tweaks that will improve his Solo performance without making him oppressive in LCS.  So it has to be something deeper.  He needs a remake about as badly as Quinn, though not for quite the same reason.

I think the aforementioned Toggle could do it, but it would need to swap his whole KIT between medium-range high-damage and long-range medium-damage, unlike Jinx' which only changes her auto-attack range.

I don't know.

I really don't know.

Like I said, I don't think this is an easy problem to solve.

Those would be straight buffs to Koggy at the LCS level, though.  And he's already strong up there.

Any change to Kog should ideally have a neutral impact on his strength in high-end play.  A damage boost at close to medium range.  Or Koggy biting/stealing health from medium to close range targets.  Something that wouldn't impact his ideal-use play pattern at all.

If you want the premier single target tank shredder, pay for it with safety. This range decrease is way more impactful in LCS where everyone knows their threat zones.

It depends on the item build and a number of other factor, really.  But yes Koggy can *potentially* win a duel with Vayne.  She holds most of the outplay cards, however.  All Kog can do is hope that the fight doesn't break out in a location with ample walls.

While they may be on similar footing in the single-target damage department later in the game, Vayne's much safer *everything* is likely why she's a pub-stomper and Koggy only exists in LCS.  A champion that needs a team built around them isn't particularly reliable in SoloQ.
